attributes.action: Initiate an investigation into enforcing a policy requiring those on benefits to undergo random drug and alcohol testing
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In Particular, all types and components of ESA, JSA and Incapacity benefit, including claims under "youth" rules.
Many of us in work and paying tax have to undergo drink and drug testing to maintain our employed status, including those working in some of the most arduous conditions, HM Forces, Oil Industry, Merchant marine,etc.
If the working taxpayer is required to remain within the law, sober and drug free to maintain our employed status we feel it is reasonable to expect those who are in receipt of benefits to remain equally within the rule of law i.e. not using illicit drugs and being sober during normal working hours. 
Those on benefits for the reasons of Ill health could reasonably be expected to remain sober and drug free. There are clear indications that drink and drugs are detrimental to health and therefore might delay recovery.
The phrase “available for and actively seeking work” would seem to preclude any person spending “normal working hours” in a state affected by drink and or drugs.
